answers.answer: He told you your baby could die and you aren't going to because you don't want to? Please do what's best for the baby and take every precaution even if you don't like it. Not much of a question if you ask me. (Since it depends on the safety of your child)

There's  no harm in taking the test, its not bad at all you drink a really sweet solution and they draw your blood after an hour and that's it. Anyone that has gestational diabetes are considered high risk and both mommy and baby will need special care. Though its highly recommended you have the right to refuse any testing offered.

I just took mine today it really wasnt that bad at all the worst part was having to sit around for 2 hours. and if your baby could die i dont understand why you would even question it. My babygirl is definitely worth more than two hours of my time. hope u decide to go thru with it :)
just go take the test and get it over with.

Just cuz it doesn't run in the family doesn't mean it couldn't start with you. 2 hours is nothing for your child. If u need convincing to do something like that in a life or death situation... what kind of mom are you going to be. Baby needs check ups too

I am the most least unlikely candidate for gestational diabetes, underweight, doesn't run in the family at all, and was always fit and healthy, but yet here i am diagnosed with it for the third time. Believe me, its a real pain in the a** thing to deal with, but if i don't control it i would be seriously harming my baby. It can cause all sorts of problems, so if you really want to continue with having a healthy pregnancy and a healthy baby at the end, i'd do the test.
